==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=uc|rs=見07}}

# [[medium]], [[diviner]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|on=[[げき]] (geki), [[けき]] (keki)
|kun=[[みこ]] (miko), [[かんなぎ]] (kannagi)
}}

===Etymology 1===
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かんなぎ}}. Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かんなぎ|神|tr1=kamu|t1=god, spirit|和ぎ|tr2=nagi|t2=calming, calming down}}, the stem noun form of verb {{m|ja|和ぐ|tr=nagu||to become calm, to become quiet}}.

{{IPAchar|/kamunagi/ → /kaɴnagi/}}

====Pronunciation====
* [[訓読み|Kun'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|/kaɴnaɡi/}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|巫}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かんなぎ}}

# a [[medium]] or [[shaman]], usually female, who acts as a [[medium]] between humans and the [[spirit]]s or [[god]]s, helping to communicate between the two and to [[calm]] any supernatural or spiritual [[upset]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|巫女|みこ}}
* {{ja-r|神子|みこ}}

===Etymology 2===
Shift in pronunciation of the {{l|ja|神|tr=''kamu''}} element, similar to the pattern seen in terms such as {{m|ja|神戸||Kōbe}}.

{{IPAchar|/kamunagi/ → /koːnagi/}}

====Pronunciation====
* [[訓読み|Kun'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|/koːnaɡi/}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|巫}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|こうなぎ}}

# alternate reading for '''kannagi'''

===Etymology 3===
Less-common [[ateji]] for {{m|ja|巫女|tr=miko||shrine maiden}}.

====Pronunciation====
* [[訓読み|Kun'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|/miko/}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|巫女}}
* {{l|ja|神子}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|みこ}}

# a [[shrine]] [[maiden]]: see {{l|ja|巫女}}
